question: Tendulkar Committee report has revealed that in 2004-05, India’s poverty which was measured 27% at that time is actually increased more than 10% and actual poverty was 37% . Which among the following was the reason behind these two conflicting measures of poverty in India?
option1: There was a discrepancy in the data’s collected at that time
option2: The new poverty line measures poverty on a wider access to commodity and services like health and education and not calories
option3: The calories definition of poverty has been changed by the world Bank
option4: The government at that time misled the public on by showing the wrong figures
answer: The new poverty line measures poverty on a wider access to commodity and services like health and education and not calories
